intro: Basanacantha annae, commonly known as the Annas' spurge, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, Basanacantha annae is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
